column4: -iMacThere4iAm: you can only install with powerpc until ubuntu edgy, in ubuntu feisty it isnt supported to powerpc
let me have a look if i can find it
Is there a quick way to find out exactly what version of ubuntu I am running?
pretty sure I got it via bittorrent but damned if I can rember where from!
would it help if i showed you my yaboot.conf file?
it runls beautifully, but atm i can still only boot from the cd
i might try installing edgy because that seems to get the yaboot settings right first time, then go over it with fiesty
and i don't want to reformat it because it has my main OS X install on it
i cleared a space, and in the installer, selected 'guided - use largest free space'
I think I am going to install edgy and upgrade
because last time I installed that, it got yaboot working without any difficulty
